Articles.Content:
I'm not sure if this deserves its own thread, but I wanted to share my first YouTube video! I edited together some footage of the Apollo 12 launch with the soundtrack from From The Earth To the Moon.

Feedback/constructive criticism is welcome.

You can see it here before it gets copy-write striked:

 

Edited May 25, 2020 by EchoLima
redid video

Subscribing right now for further updates.

Transitions are great, and the master caution/warning panel really nice. However, my only two recommendations would be to add some F-1 engine sound at lift-off and for a short while following it, just to give it more punch. Secondly but far from being essential, 42 seconds until lift-off is a bit long to most viewers. Many would probably jump to T-10 s instead of waiting and appreciating the mix between images and sounds.

7 hours ago, XB-70A said:

Transitions are great, and the master caution/warning panel really nice. However, my only two recommendations would be to add some F-1 engine sound at lift-off and for a short while following it, just to give it more punch. Secondly but far from being essential, 42 seconds until lift-off is a bit long to most viewers. Many would probably jump to T-10 s instead of waiting and appreciating the mix between images and sounds.

Thanks for the feedback! I remade the video with those changes.

Edited May 26, 2020 by EchoLima
